message: "Human trafficking is a form of modern slavery where people are exploited through forced labor, sex trafficking, and domestic servitude for another person's gain through a means of forced fraud or coercion," says Casey Alvarez, executive director of Go 61-an organization committed to serving victims of human trafficking. Alvarez says that if House Bill 1246 passes, the posters would be seen in places like airports, bus stations, truck stops, strip clubs, hotels, and motels.

data.description: The continuous fight to combat human trafficking in Missouri reaches the state capitol.
data.title: Posters Could Help Victims of Human Trafficking
